fields.name: surveyID
fields.title: Survey ID
fields.description: The identifier for the survey. Important if more there is more than one survey a the project.

fields.name: surveyName
fields.title: Survey Name
fields.example: Disentangling the effects of farmland use, habitat edges, and vegetation structure on ground beetle morphological traits - Summer

fields.name: surveyPurpose
fields.title: Survey Purpose
fields.description: A description of the survey objective

fields.name: surveyType
fields.title: Survey Type
fields.description: Description of type of survey conducted

fields.name: surveyEnd
fields.title: Survey End
fields.description: The date data collection was completed.

fields.name: targetTaxonomicScope
fields.title: Target Taxonomic Scope
fields.description: The range of biological taxa covered by the survey. Multiple terms are allowed, separated by a vertical bar aka pipe |

fields.name: targetHabitatScope
fields.title: Target Habitat Scope
fields.description: The habitats targeted for sampling during the survey. Multiple terms are allowed, separated by a vertical bar aka pipe |

fields.name: spatialCoverageWKT
fields.title: Spatial Coverage (WKT)
fields.description: Well Known Text (WKT) expression of the geographic coordinates that describe the survey's spatial extent.

fields.name: geodeticDatum
fields.title: Spatial Coverage (Geodetic Datum)
fields.description: The geodetic datum upon which the geographic coordinates in the Spatial coverage (WKT) are based.

fields.name: surveyOrganisation
fields.title: Survey Organisation
fields.description: Name of organisation or individual for whom Survey is being conducted. Multiple terms are allowed, separated by a vertical bar aka pipe |
fields.example: NSW Department of Planning, Industry and Environment | CSIRO

fields.name: samplingPerformedBy
fields.title: Sampling Performed By
fields.description: Similar to eco:samplingPerformedBy. Individual/s that carried out the survey. These can be represented by identifiers. Multiple values allare allowed, separated by a vertical bar aka pipe |

fields.name: surveyMethodCitation
fields.title: Survey Method Citation
fields.description: A citation or reference to the survey methods used.
fields.example: Ng, K., Barton, P.S., Blanchard, W. et al. Disentangling the effects of farmland use, habitat edges, and vegetation structure on ground beetle morphological traits. Oecologia 188, 645–657 (2018). https://doi.org/10.1007/s00442-018-4180-9

fields.name: surveyMethodDescription
fields.title: Survey Method Description
fields.description: Free text description of the survey method used.
fields.example: Our experimental design consisted of four 400 m transects running from inside each woodland patch out into four adjoining farmland uses (crop, rested, woody debris application, revegetation plantings). To quantify potential edge efects on beetle species traits, we sampled beetles at five locations along each transect: 200 and 20 m inside woodlands, 200 and 20 m inside farmlands, and at the woodland–farmland edge (0 m). Each sampling location comprised a pair of wet invertebrate pitfall traps.  separated by a drift fence (60 cm long x 10 cm high) to help direct arthropods into traps. We opened a total of 220 pairs of traps for 14 days during spring (Oct–Nov 2014), and repeated sampling during summer (January–February 2015). Beetle samples from each pitfall trap pair, and across the two time periods, were pooled to provide one sample per sampling location.

fields.name: surveyMethodURL
fields.title: Survey Method URL
fields.description: A DOI or link to the reference about the survey method, if available.

fields.name: samplingEffortValue
fields.title: Sample Effort
fields.description: Similar to eco:samplingEffortValue. The total sampling effort value. A samplingEffortValue must have a corresponding samplingEffortUnit

fields.name: samplingEffortUnit
fields.title: Sampling Effort Units
fields.description: Similar to eco:samplingEffortUnit. The units associated with samplingEffortValue.

fields.name: keywords
fields.title: Keywords
fields.description: Terms, phrases or descriptors that highlight the key attributes of the study. Multiple terms are allowed, separated by a vertical bar aka pipe |
fields.example: ground beetle | habitat | morphology | traits | farmland | woodland | remnant vegetation | split-plot study
